boardgame.name: Lasalle (Second Edition)
boardgame.description:
Lasalle is a tactical Napoleonics game suitable for beginners or veterans in which any army can fight any other or you can play historical scenarios. Players are a division or corps commander leading battalions of infantry, batteries of artillery and regiments of cavalry. A game is an affair for about three hours’ play on a modest table with about a dozen units on each side with no paperwork other than marking disruption against a unit's track.

The second edition has a new sequence of play, driven by momentum and interrupts, allows players to do virtually anything in any order, differently every turn. Completely new rules for the use of the general figure (i.e. “you”) permit you to choose the personality and effect of your intervention in the sequence. Skirmishing has been reinvented from the top-down. The two sides contribute skirmishers to their opposing “screens” and each turn they determine which side’s screen has the advantage. That, in turn, affects the momentum and sequence, not to mention possibly preventing worn units from rallying, obscuring targets from shooters, or even sniping at infantry units as they try to change formations. Movement has been radically simplified. Rather than worrying about evolutions of individual units, movement gets you from point A to B with a certain number of “complications” that accrue as you try to do difficult things like changing formation near the enemy, moving through difficult terrain, interpenetrating, or attacking. Combat has been redesigned so that it is a more decisive either/or experience. Troops either press an attack home, or they are discouraged and fall back with few casualties to either side.

Second Edition Lasalle is a much more holistic game where you are playing not just individual units but rather an entire military effort, and everything affects everything else. You control the sequence and pace of events while your opponent tries to wrest that control from you. What your soldiers can accomplish is not just the result of moving them and rolling dice, but part of the overall situation into which you’ve led your army.

boardgame.name: The Element Dragons
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Periodic Table

Elemental dragons are considered the purest of their kind. Each dragon’s body consists of one of the most basic materials that can be found in all the multiverse. Their origins are unknown, but it is believed that they came into being at the same time as the Material Plane.

boardgame.name: Archvillain Archive
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Archvillain Archive is a compendium of evil people. Far from monsters and creatures, these individuals represent the worst that personhood has to other. Each villain comes with a backstory designed to demonstrate their motives and history, which can easily be inserted into any game. A custom stat block is included for every villain, including Legendary—and even Mythic—actions. With Challenge Ratings spanning 15 to 30, each character included in this text is capable of being the infernal boss of a campaign! From warlords to wizards to reality-warping liches, your next Archvillain is here!

boardgame.name: Harry Potter: Memory Master
boardgame.description:
A CARD GAME FOR THE WHOLE FAMILY: Put your memory to the ultimate test with your fellow witches and wizards at your next magical party and game night with this incredibly entertaining Harry Potter card game that the whole family can enjoy.

—description from the publisher

In this game, players are split in pairs. Each round, each player receives five cards. They get a moment to study their cards, and then exchange them with their partners. Then, each player plays one card facedown (with the intention to pick one that matches the one their partner will play). The played cards are then turned face-up. A team scores two points if both the color and the character on their cards match, and one point if either the color or the character matches. The first team to reach twelve points wins the game.

—user summary

listing.notes:
New in shrink wrap.
All prices are inclusive of VAT, but do not include shipping costs, and a possible fee, if you pay using Paypal.
Shipping Cost: please look below

boardgame.name: Gamestormers
boardgame.description:
Gamestormers is a creative, tableau-building card game for 3-6 players. In the game, you are a young, up-and-coming gamestormer in the futuristic land of Fjerogard who must impress the Elder Gamestormer with a great new game idea. The object of the game is to design and pitch a great game idea to the rest of the players.

During the game, players fill out their game tableaus using a variety of actions, such as taking Item cards from the market, drafting Storyline and Mechanic cards, designing custom cards using dice with images, or entering the Arena. All of the actions allow the player to acquire new cards for the game they are designing or earn victory points.

There are two ways to win the game - either create a game that is worth the most victory points, or receive the most votes for best overall game from your fellow players. The game you create consists of a Storyline card, two Mechanic cards, and two Items cards, each of which you will use to create a cohesive game narrative. Each card in your game tableau earns you points, as well as other bonuses you can activate by reaching certain objectives.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Colored Bases
boardgame.description: A polybagged set of four extra bases for your Car Wars minis in red, yellow, blue, and green.

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Clear Bases
boardgame.description: A polybagged set of four clear bases for your Car Wars minis or wrecks.

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Double Drum Playmat
boardgame.description:
A fan-favorite arena, rebuilt for the newest edition of the classic game of automotive combat!

The original 1988 arena design has been updated to suit Car Wars Sixth Edition and measures a whopping 4' x 6'! The Double Drum Playmat has been re-sized, redesigned, and crafted especially for Car Wars Sixth Edition – we've eliminated the entrances and stands and modified the shape.

The basic Car Wars Sixth Edition game is usually played on a 3' x 3' arena or roadway, giving the players just enough room to vroom and boom their way to victory. However, as the game reaches more and more tabletops, we've heard many of you ask for larger playing surfaces. Here it is – our largest official playmat to date!

boardgame.name: Rising Sun: The First Sino-Japanese War, 1894-1895
boardgame.description:
"Rising Sun: The First Sino-Japanese War, 1894-1895" is a historical board wargame that deals with the entire First Sino-Japanese War, which was the first foreign war for modern Japan. Players take charge of Japan or the Qing Dynasty and fight for control of the Korean Peninsula, Liaodong Peninsula, Shandong Peninsula, and Penghu Islands. Alternatively, the Japanese Army can challenge the Zhili decisive battle.

As with historical facts, the Navy has a big role to play in games. At that time, the infrastructure was not well-developed, and it was the transport vessels that could most efficiently carry large numbers of troops and supplies, and command of the sea was needed to secure maritime transport. How will the Combined Fleet challenge the Beiyang Fleet, which has the battleships Dingyuan and Zhenyuan, which were called the strongest ships in the Orient? And how will the Japanese Army capture the fortress of Lushun and Weihaiwei?

The game system of this game is called card-driven, and makes full use of cards that represent war resources and historical events and tactics. But more important than how to use the card is a "strategy" that looks at how to end the war.

boardgame.description: Simplicity in Practice is a set of miniature wargame rules for the Horse-and-Musket period published in the wargaming magazine Battlegames (Issue 23). It aims to use very simple mechanisms to aid understanding and speed of play.

boardgame.name: Things... Schitt's Creek: Bébé Game
boardgame.description:
Everyone’s favorite game meets everyone’s favorite show! In this hilarious game, you read a topic card and then write down your response. It can be anything that comes to mind—there’s no right or wrong answer! Then all the responses are read aloud, and you have to figure out who said what! You won’t believe the THINGS… the people you know will come up with! With the Schitt’s Creek Edition, explore your thoughts about the show and it’s hilarious characters and see what THINGS… you’ll say!

Note: This is a smaller version of Things... Schitt's Creek which contains only 70 cards, compared to 188 cards and additional components found in the later version.

boardgame.name: Guédelon: Le Moulin
boardgame.description: This is a mini-expansion that came with the Kickstarter version but is also available for download from Asychron games. The mill is an additional building that increases the difficulty and extends the visitors' tour of the premises.

boardgame.name: Spuntino in Sardegna
boardgame.description:
If you too have eaten Casu marzu, if you always carry the Island in your heart, you have chosen the perfect game.
Spuntino is quick and easy, perfect for an evening with friends or family, ideal for adults and children who love good regional cuisine.

With Spuntino's illustrated cards, you can indulge yourself in inventing new culinary combinations and combine a thousand flavors to get more points than your opponents.
Are you ready for an explosion of Sardinian tastes?
Each game lasts about 30 minutes, just like a real snack, and then you'll be ready for a new game where you can enjoy new delightful flavors.
You will have 110 illustrated playing cards at your disposal to create the most combinations and declare a snack. You can also create delicious combinations with wine and "filu'e ferru" and become the sommelier of the family.

The aim of this board game is to get the highest number of points by making combinations of typical Sardinian dishes. To win, you will have to become the Snack King by getting more points than your opponents.

boardgame.name: Paddy McGinty's Goat
boardgame.description:
Paddy McGinty's Goat is an Australian game based on a 1917 war-time comic song of the same name. Performed by the American duo The Two Bobs (Bob Alden and Bob Adams). It tells the story of an aggressive goat that enters the village of Killaloe in Ireland. The original score also has the goat defeating the German army and the Kaiser

A simple roll and move game where players use a small wooden marble to move along a path by the roll of he dice. The playing board is slightly elevated at one end to create a slope. The path mostly contains a series small holes for the marble to sit, but every so often on the path is a much larger hole where if a player lands directly on the large hole by the dice roll then the wooden marble falls through and rolls down the slope to the start and the player must begin again.

A player may "Butt" an opponent forward if he directly lands on that player. First player to reach Paddy McGinty's Goat's right eye is deemed the winner.

boardgame.name: From the Moon
boardgame.description:
In From the Moon, players are representatives of factions trying to complete space missions departing from our Moon in order to help Humankind survive elsewhere in the Galaxy. Indeed, the fate of the Earth is sealed and time is running out!

The plan is to launch three survival missions before all life on Earth ends. To do that, each faction will contribute by building parts of the ships and build their own Lunar base to store the necessary resources.
In the end, which faction will be most suited to lead the future of our race out there, far away in space?

—description from the publisher (translated).

boardgame.name: Podaj Łapę
boardgame.description:
This time it is you give a paw to your four-legged friends!

The players volunteer for the shelter and help find suitable dog houses.
The participant of the game must plan and execute a training plan for his pupils in order to improve their skills and strengthen their qualities. Each of the owners who want to adopt a pet expects different characteristics. Some are looking for a companionable and patient dog, others - courageous and strong.
Pass the paw and become a friend of the animals!

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Find Your Way Out
boardgame.description:
Are you ready to lift the secret of the library?

With horror you discover that you're trapped inside the dark Monestary library. Your only chance to escape are 30 riddles you discover hidden in a Bible...

A bible themed escape game for home..

listing.notes:
Original German version.
Box shows little wear. Inside everything there in great condition. Game has been played once without damaging / destroying anything.

boardgame.name: All the Colors of the Sky
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Hitotsuna Town, a quiet little town in rural Japan. On the surface it’s an ordinary place, but this is a town with the most wonderful secrets.

This book is a compilation of bonus material for Golden Sky Stories from the Kickstarters for both Golden Sky Stories and Twlight Tales.


A replay (transcript of a game session), "The Broken Window"
13 new residents, ranging from new kinds of henge to the witch and magical girl
New types of human NPCs
Five scenarios, plus a collection of story seeds and "Henge Sweets," an essay about Japanese snacks and how to use them in stories
A guide to the Land of Illusions, with rules for creating residents and the new miko and fairy character types
Engine Sky, a short alternate setting about robots helping people in a post-apocalyptic world
Two prose short stories: A Lively Summer and Kaminaga-hime's Soccer Ball


This book compiles all of the material from The Colors of the Sky and The Colors of the Sky Volume 2: Kappa and Oni's Excellent Adventure. You will need the Golden Sky Stories core rulebook to play, and you will need Twilight Tales to use some of the material.

— From the publisher blurb.

boardgame.name: Moto Rider GO: Highway Traffic
boardgame.description:
Race the traffic in the best Motorcycle Racing game ever!

Moto Rider GO: Highway Traffic brings to you a compelling and satisfying traffic dodging experience in the world!

Features:
- Licensed Husqvarna and KTM motorcycle models
- Choose from the fastest high-performance motorcycles!
- Enjoy extreme 3D visuals!
- Prove your skills in hardcore challenges!
- Upgrade your speed, breaking level, and add extra lives!
- Make near traffic misses discovering 4 unique locations: Suburbs, Desert, Snow, and Night City
- Ride your motorcycle on a highway, interstate, or the autobahn!
- Discover plenty of bike tuning options!

ENDLESS GAMEPLAY
Head out and race as fast as you can to become the new moto rider in the world! Race the traffic and complete the challenges to get real among the competition. Jump on your racing bike and ride on the endless busy roads and highways! Make near traffic misses discovering 4 unique locations: Suburbs, Desert, Snow, and Night City in 4 different modes! Ride your motorcycle on a highway, interstate, or the autobahn. Never forget that riding a motorcycle can be fun, but it can also be dangerous! Roads and highways are full of speeding cars – they can bother you!

SELECTION OF HIGH-PERFORMANCE MOTORBIKES
Have you ever wanted to ride a motorcycle in real life? Great! It's about time to test your skills and decide on the motorcycle category you would choose – extremely fast superbike, epic chopper motorcycles, or modified high-performance versions of off-road motorcycles! Every bike has its own individual extras: total lives, near miss bonus, high-speed bonus, or wrong way bonus.

A TON OF TUNING AND CUSTOMIZATION OPTIONS
Go to the garage and select one of the licensed, high-performance motorbikes. Tune your vehicle and customize its appearance. Choose your favorite body color and slap on some well-designed decals! Give your rides your own style. Increase your motorbike's speed, breaking level and add extra lives – these will all have a definite impact on your bike's performance.

boardgame.name: Mutant Mudds Collection
boardgame.description:
The Ultimate Mutant Mudds Experience! - 3 GAMES IN ONE -

It’s the greatest collection of muddy games under one roof! Revisit the platforming fun of the award winning Mutant Mudds Deluxe and Mutant Mudds Super Challenge on your Nintendo Switch™. But wait, there’s more! A brand-new game has been added to the collection!! Fend off the rising mudds from below in the new explosive puzzler, Mudd Blocks.

1. MUTANT MUDDS DELUXE
Love pixels? Fond of platformers? Is there a special place in your heart for the 8-bit and 16-bit era? Want to have fun? Yes!? Well, you've come to the right place, my friend. Mutant Mudds Deluxe is a "12-bit" action platformer with 80 levels full of pixels and platforming fun!

Our hero, Max, may be just a 2D sprite, but he can leap into the third dimension by jetting between the background and the foreground playfields with his trusty jetpack in this unique dimensionally-woven experience.

Armed with a heavy-duty water cannon, Max has what he needs to vanquish his long-term nemesi: the Mutant Mudds. Max must blast and hover his way across the soiled landscape to seek out mysterious Water Sprites. Legend says collecting all of the mysterious Water Sprites will wash the filthy Mutant Mudds away for good!

2. MUTANT MUDDS SUPER CHALLENGE
Here comes a challenge! Mutant Mudds Super Challenge!! Over 40 levels filled with malicious mutant mudds. This adventure is designed for super players; featuring a host of new platforming challenges and unique boss fights that will test your skills.

Max receives special intel, revealing the location of the original meteor impact site and the fact that mutant mudds are still being spawned from it! Max sets out from a secret hideout in the jungle to locate the meteor and destroy it for good!

Run, jump, hover, and blast your way across five new vibrant worlds, presented with colorful neo-retro pixel art and sublime chiptune music. Defy the laws of the second dimension by leaping between foreground and background layers, dispensing muddy justice with your faithful water cannon. Utilize your trusty power-ups to traverse tricky obstacles and gain access to special secret levels.

3. MUDD BLOCKS
Max’s mudd-busting work is never done! A muddy horde of mutants is rising up from below… in block form!? Throw water bombs down to wash them away. You can even use the multicolored mudd blocks against themselves. Anything goes! Go solo and best your high score or team up with a friend for two player co-op or head-to-head versus fun. You can even try one of the other unique modes, such as Numbers and Rescue to put your block-busting skills to the test.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Not Not: A Brain Buster
boardgame.description:
Just go Up, Down, Left or Right. Easy, is it NOT?The ultimate brain-busting challenge finally on Nintendo Switch and with a Multiplayer mode!

Downloaded 10 million times on mobiles, this Top 1 Puzzle game in 14 countries (including USA, UK, Australia and Canada) was remastered and features:
• Exclusive Multiplayer Versus mode. Share the brain busting in NORMAL, HARD or EXTREME
• Classic mode. Each level raises the difficulty up with new instructions
• Challenge mode. Reach the best score in a bottomless pit of despair
• Color blind accessibility mode

This misleading expert aims at crushing your brain's ability to think properly. Can yours handle it? Find out now.

boardgame.name: OMG Police - Car Chase TV Simulator
boardgame.description:
This is an action game where you run away from the police while being part of Chase TV news.

Choose one of two powerful locations: Los Angeles and Area 51 military base in Nevada (watch out for UFOs).

Your task is to survive as long as possible, and while escaping you can collect hundreds of thousands of dollars, which are scattered around different locations. For the money you collect, buy another car that is faster and more durable.
You can destroy everything you encounter, but remember to repair your car!

● 20 great cars
● Hundreds of dollars for new cars
● Car repair points
● Live coverage on Chase TV

boardgame.name: Overlanders
boardgame.description:
Battle it out in 5 PLAYER MULTIPLAYER or rage through the CAMPAIGN. Overlanders delivers the futuristic, competitive racing experience of your dreams. INVITE YOUR FRIENDS and tear up the tracks together.

•Try our arsenal of weapons, while mastering the mesmerizing,
stunning tracks of other planets.
•The high-speed hover physics lets you clear the track with insane speed and feel.
•Upgrade and master the unique racers to suit your style.
•Shields, turbos, missiles and traps you got them all, with multiple online and offline game modes.
•Rush to victory in MONSTER HUNT a unique game mode, never seen in combat racing games before.

boardgame.name: Fog of Love: Valentine's Day 2020 promo
boardgame.description:
Promotional card for Valentine's Day 2020.

You suggest a quiet night at home.

Promo 17

boardgame.name: Picklock
boardgame.description:
You are a thief. Alias Picklock. Examine the robbery scene. Break in. Sneak and steal. Escape. Become a pro! Enjoy Picklock, a strategic adventure with isometric view and voxel graphics!

FEATURES:
• isometric mix of strategy, adventure and stealth;
• 13 challenging missions;
• real estate agency to buy your dream house;
• car dealership to pimp your ride;
• jazzy tunes to listen and chill out to;
• travel agency so you can go on a well-deserved vacation;
• voxel graphics.

Are you bored with an average, honest life?

Picklock gives you an opportunity to break in, steal and deceive your way to a luxury, yet an illegal lifestyle.

In each level, you will face a new challenge. Your targets will range from a roll of toilet paper at your neighbours' house to exclusive art, electronics and cold, hard cash. And even though you know your stuff, you'll have to deal with security, alarms and sealed, secret compartments.

If any of those things will stress you out, you can always go on a shopping spree, chill out at a pub or let off some steam at a gentlemen's club.

Excited yet?

Then grab your gloves and crowbar and get ready for a tricky, robbery adventure!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Darkridge Reunion
boardgame.description:
It’s Jocks vs. Geeks vs. Rebels in this live action game that’s part murder mystery, part survival game and entirely devious.

Darkridge Reunion is a dynamic whodunnit party game played over three rounds. Each player is given a role (jock, geek, or rebel) and are attending a high school reunion.

Players will use social deduction and clues to find who is on which team but more importantly who is the slasher.

Each player is given a secret mission and an artifact.

boardgame.name: Schalten: Aber Schlau – Das Große Energieeffizienzspiel
boardgame.description:
Schalten - Aber Schlau: Das Große Energieeffizienzspiel is a trivia game about energy usage put out by a German energy supplier to help folks learn about their energy efficiency.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Final Light-Year: The Jade Sector
boardgame.description:
November 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

This kit adds the new sector map, a spaceport, commander and minion ships and a new market card.


Released in the November 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

boardgame.name: The Final Light-Year: The Krog Sector
boardgame.description:
December 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

This kit adds a new sector map, new overlord, commander and minion ships, and new crew.


Released in the December 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

boardgame.name: Pirates: All Aboard!
boardgame.description:
Ahoy Pirates! Th' sea be callin' - choose a ship, brin' yer mates 'n set sail on th' vast seas - All hands hoay!
Pirates: All Aboard! is a competitive battle game for solo and multiplayer experiences.

Rule the seas!
- Choose your ship wisely - Exploit each of thee ships’ strengths ‘n weaknesses
- Skillfully navigate between Caribbean tropical islands on 7 maps!
- Collect all thee power-ups 'n fire devastatin' cannon blasts.
- Be merciless to yee enemies 'n remember - Dead men tell no tales.

Enjoy 3 game modes yarr!
1) Practice Mode - Practice will make ye a true Seadog!
2) Multiplayer (Death Match and Last Man Standing) - All scallywags are needed aboard, brin' yer mates and together commandeer thar seas
3) Endless Mode - show yer agility 'n collect a bounty of treasures, don't let yer ship sink - River Raid style!

Yo Ho Ho!
Weigh Anchor and Hoist the Mizzen!
Aaaarrrrgggghhhh!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Pool Pro Gold
boardgame.description:
The classic eight-ball pool for your Nintendo Switch™! Play against the best in a quick match or tournaments. Play, win and unlock new equipment.

FEATURES:
• Yes, the very classic 8-Ball!
• Pool hall on your Nintendo Switch™!
• Realistic gameplay!
• Various game modes!
• Beautiful design!
• Professional tournaments!
• Different cues!

DESCRIPTION:
Enjoy the very best, classic eight-ball pool!
Aim carefully and hit the cue ball perfectly!

Play at different tables around the world with different stakes and prizes.
Take part in tournaments and get great prizes.

The more you win the more you earn.
Spend on new cues and avatars!
Be smart and boost your skill to reach to the top.

Become the world champion!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Awimbawé
boardgame.description:
The king is dead. Who will succeed him...

The two-player trick-taking game Awimbawé presents a duel for the throne of the animal kingdom, with each player trying to use the animals of the savannah to win more crowns than their rival while avoiding the pack of hyenas. Win two rounds to become the new king or queen of the savannah.

The card deck consists of 28 cards: 24 animal cards numbered 1-6 in four suits, and four eagle cards in a fifth suit. Shuffle the deck, then deal four cards separately face down to each player, then deal four cards face up on top of these cards (to create four piles of two cards), then split the remaining cards so that each player has a hand of six cards.

On a turn as the lead player, you can play any of your available cards, whether one in your hand or one face up on the table. The opponent must then play a card of the same suit, if possible. If they can't, they must play an eagle — and if they can't play an eagle, they can play anything. If the two cards played are of the same suit, the higher card wins. If the opponent played an eagle, they can make it flee (placing it in their own scoring pile and ceding the trick) or they can make it fight, winning the trick. If the opponent played off suit, the lead player wins the trick, collects the cards, and leads again. At the end of a trick, if you have a face-down card on top of a pile, reveal this card, making it available for play.

The round ends when either a player collects their fourth hyena (losing the round immediately) or all cards have been played. In the latter case, count the crowns on collected cards to see who has the higher score. The first player to win two rounds wins the game.

boardgame.name: Powertris
boardgame.description:
An electrifying combination of Tetris and Pipemania - a puzzle game that will test your constructional AND plumbing skills!

20 nouveaux invités inspiré de fans du Château Lafortune

boardgame.name: Bacci Pagano: il gioco
boardgame.description:
The game is inspired by Bruno Morchio's novels starring Bacci Pagano, an ironic and disillusioned Genoese private investigator.

You will have to work together to help the famous Genoese private investigator Bacci Pagano to solve five cases. Five unpublished stories set between Genoa and Sardinia, a map of the city and a newspaper page full of clues: this is the material contained in the box that, together with a good dose of investigative intuition and a spirit of adventure, will guide you in the investigation.

The game contains five stories:

Book thieves
The suspect ship
Transfer to Ogliastra
In the age of coronavirus
Invisible lives

boardgame.name: Hunt a Killer: The Mystery of Hunter's Lodge
boardgame.description:
Wealthy magnate Harrington Pace has been murdered. Captain Arthur Hastings would typically employ the expertise of renowned detective Hercule Poirot, but the legendary sleuth has come down with a bout of influenza. Hastings turns to the world’s second greatest detective to help solve the case: you. Tackle the case one clue at a time by solving puzzles, diving into the evidence, and eliminating the suspects one by one.

CHALLENGE YOURSELF
‍‍
Work with Arthur Hastings to sort through the evidence and find clues to catch the murderer.
Be the main character and solve an Agatha Christie case in this murder mystery game.

boardgame.name: アウランド (OWLAND)
boardgame.description:
アウランド (OWLAND) is a push your luck game from Japan. The cards are double-headed, that is, you play the top or bottom face of the card depending on it being night or day.

The publisher says:
Owland is a world with many forests of owls. Each player is an owl, who lives in a different forest. One day, this
Owland is troubled by crow, the owls' natural enemy. Try to defend your forest, even at the cost of having other forests taken over by the crow...!

You are immediately eliminated if you draw the Crow card from the deck. Try to avoid it by effectively using Day-Night tokens and the cards with effects that vary between day and night.

The last surviving player wins in this Russian roulette style card game. Enjoy the accelerating manoeuvring and thrills!

ふくろうの森がいっぱいの世界『ＯＷＬＡＮＤ』
プレイヤーは別々の森に住むふくろう。ある日やってきた天敵のカラスにふくろうたちは大騒ぎ！！　カラスから自分の森を守り抜け！　たとえ他の森がカラスに乗っ取られようとも…
山札から「カラスカード」を引き取ったら脱落。昼夜チップや、昼と夜で効果の変わるカードを上手く使って、カラスカードを回避しよう。最後まで１人残ったプレイヤーが勝利するロシアンルーレット系カードゲームです。
段々と加速する駆け引きとドキドキを味わえます！！
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Tatarite (たたリテ)
boardgame.description:
たたリテ (Tatarite) is a trick-taking card game from Japan.

The publisher says:
This tricking-taking game for two to four players was developed from the idea of a game incorporating an element of "color" to Five Cucumbers.

Each round is comprised of seven tricks, and the only thing that matters is who wins the seventh trick. The player who plays the highest number card in the seventh trick wins the round and gets a Heart token. Whoever collects two Heart tokens first wins the game.

Based on the orthodox trick-taking rules, in which you must follow suit, this game is characterized by the changes made to the ranks in the seventh trick. So how would you prepare for it over the six tricks up to that point?

Feel the sensation of outwitting the opponent as well as that of being outwitted. You can experience various emotions in a short gameplay.

""5本のキュウリに色がついたら""をテーマに作った２～４人用のトリックテイキング。
１ラウンドは７回の勝負からなっていますが、勝てばいいのは７回目だけ。
７回目の勝負で一番大きい数字を出したプレイヤーがそのラウンドの勝者となり、「ハートトークン」を獲得できます。誰よりも早く「ハートトークン」を２個集めたプレイヤーがゲームの勝者となります。
トリテのオーソドックスなルールであるマストフォローをベースに、ランクが特徴的な本作。７回目のトリックではランクが変わる仕掛けが施された新鮮なトリテ。
６回目までの勝負でどう準備するのか。思惑がはまった時の快感、相手にしてやられた時の悔しさ。短時間でいろんな感情を味わえるゲームに仕上がっています。
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Operation Fallen Warrior
boardgame.description:
From the product description:

Operation Fallen Warrior is an espionage mission for the Modus Operandi role playing game for 1-4 first level agents.

British agent Alex Carruthers has been captured by the Libyans after being caught attempting to obtain details of Soviet operations in the region.

Due to current sensitivities the British have requested the assistance of a PANTHEON team who are tasked with the recovery of Carruthers.

Their mission will take them into the heart of a Soviet-run detention centre in Libyan, across the desert to Cairo and, finally, to within touching distance of the Pyramids of Giza.

Included are VTT (72dpi) and printable battlemats (300dpi) versions of the location maps created for the mission allowing Handlers the flexibility of using this adventure online or face-to-face.

boardgame.name: Traveller Utility Pack
boardgame.description:
From Publisher's Website:

The Traveller Utility Pack contains two 50-sheet pads of full colour character sheets and subsector maps. The character sheet can be folded into 4-page booklet that keeps your most pertinent details front and centre while also forming a handy pocket for adventure handouts. The blank subsector maps allow you to explore the unfathomable depths of uncharted space, creating your own unique universe as you go.

boardgame.name: Super Hydorah
boardgame.description:
Challenging and handcrafted: a declaration of love to shmups

An evil force has launched an invasion over the Omios star! Fly with the space fleet in a campaign to liberate planets, destroy enemy bases and discover the misterious force behind the attack. Biomechanical enemies, space creatures, exotic planets and climatic threats are waiting for you, so select a route, equip your ship and prepare to die!

Super Hydorah is a side scroller non-linear SHMUP which gives the player a challenging experience with the best from the greatest classics of the genre: straightforward action, old school visuals and a wide array of content with unique space settings.

Features

· Easy to learn, hard to master!
· 21 levels divided into 35 sublevels, 35 bosses and more than 100 enemies
· 3 game modes: single player, co-op multiplayer and the minigame robot chase
· Non-linear level layout with route selection
· Analog and super precise control of your ship
· Dangers of different nature in each level (not just bullets)
· Weapon selection and power-ups in every mission
· Original soundtrack with 60+ tracks
· Secrets, multiple endings, trophies and rank system
· CRT Monitor effect

boardgame.name: Toree 3D
boardgame.description:
The fastest bird alive!

A bite-sized 3D Platformer with a few weird elements. Life as a chirp is hard: As Toree straddles about, a creepy mean guy comes rushing along and steals Toree's ice cream. In an attempt to right this wrong, Toree starts a furious chase through nine carefully crafted levels with a strong emphasis on speed and flow.

Features:
- Late 90s low poly aesthetic
- Fast paced platforming
- 9 levels with unique elements
- 2 secret characters to unlock
- speed rankings in each level to promote replayability

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Wunderling
boardgame.description:
Chase down the Hero across beautiful scrolling levels and show him who’s the real BOSS!

Take control of the Wunderling, a low-level video game goon who has just unlocked the power to jump. Unable to stop or change direction at will, you will need to plan ahead and master the Wunderlings’ abilities to navigate treacherous scrolling levels and chase down that pesky Hero.

Features:
• Jump between platforms and solve puzzles with one hand!
• Discover a hidden treasure on each stage.
• Unlock the hidden Wunder-moves, like “Boost” and “Wall-Jump”!
• Enjoy beautiful bite-sized pixel art.
• Customize your Wunderling with more than 27 million outfit combinations.
• Track down the Hero; in this game YOU are the boss!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Xenon Racer
boardgame.description:
In the near future, the official racing federation has ordered a seasons pause from racing, to allow teams to ease into the transition to flying vehicles. To bridge this gap, top hybrid car manufacturers host a rogue championship for rookie drivers on the streets of cities worldwide. Their advanced cars drive on electricity and Xenon gas, resulting in crazy speeds. Get behind the wheel, keep your adrenaline in check and drift through the streets. Boost to absurd speeds and become the ultimate Xenon Racer!

Features:
Race at top speeds in electric vehicles boosted by Xenon gas
Drift through the streets of cities like Tokyo and Dubai in 2030
Triumph in singleplayer, split-screen & online multiplayer championships
Customize your car with tons of parts to create the ultimate racing vehicle

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Maglev Metro: London & Paris
boardgame.description:
Maglev Metro: London & Paris features two new expansion maps for Maglev Metro:

In London, one of the world's oldest subway system is finally getting a much needed upgrade thanks to magnetic levitation technology! In order to reinvigorate London's transportation system, all stations are unlocked; pick up any passenger even on your first turn!


Players start with extra passengers to activate more areas on their player board.
London is divided into districts, and you'll need access to build track to various parts of the city.
The new Unlock Districts extension modifies your player board so instead of unlocking passenger colors, players unlock districts.


And then there's Paris, well known for its mass transit strikes and your new Maglev Metro enterprise there is no exception. There are strikes scheduled constantly throughout the city at various stations!


Union bosses strike at a different station every few turns, shutting down all business at affected stations: trains zip right on past the stations and passengers cannot be picked up or dropped off until they reopen.
They're so brazen they've published a strike schedule! At least this helps you plan ahead of time.
Defy the picket lines as a strike breaker, which costs you VPs in order to save you time.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Pursuit of Happiness: Holiday Pack
Das Streben nach Glück: Feiertags-Pack
boardgame.description:
A set of 20 holiday-themed cards.

The preview photo of the expansion shows the cards:
- Christmas celebration
- Lunar calendar
- Trick or treating

boardgame.name: The Pursuit of Happiness: KS Promos 4
Das Streben nach Glück: Spieleschmiede Promo-Pack 4
boardgame.description:
This set is sold exclusively at Kickstarter (English edition) and Spieleschmiede (German edition).

A set of 20 cards including all previous promo cards... and more!

The preview photo of the expansion shows the cards:
- Camping (A new activity card.)
- Maui (Maui is an additional Trip card that can be added to the Experiences expansion game.)
- Order from Artipia (Order From Artipia promo card is an additional Standard Project that can be added to the base game.)
- Perform Magic (Perform Magic is an additional Group Project that can be added to the base game.)
- Scrapbooking
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Pursuit of Happiness: Big Box
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: The Pursuit of Happiness: Camping Activity Promo Card
The Pursuit of Happiness: Experiences – Maui
The Pursuit of Happiness: Order From Artipia
The Pursuit of Happiness: Perform Magic Promo Card

boardgame.name: Doomtown: Weird West Edition
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Doomtown, where you try to gain control of a western town set in the Weird West of Deadlands. In this world, cowpokes good and bad wield guns, steampunk gadgets, and spells of all sorts, and death is sometimes just a minor inconvenience.

In Deadwood, South Dakota, Eagle woman That All Look At tries to enforce a fragile treaty. Hao-Te Zui's Anarchists fight for the townsfolk that E.B Farnum's consortium of Entrepreneurs are trying to drive out of business. Bass Reeves, the West's most persistent Marshal, arrives in pursuit of the notorious outlaw, Jessica Patchett, who's trying to escape her bloody past. And out in the Badlands, Ursula's cult prepares to summon the power of the great Worm.

Doomtown: Weird West Edition is a poker-driven, territory control card game, updated from (and fully compatible with) the 2014 release of Doomtown: Reloaded, which was based on the 1998 Origins Awards Best Trading Card Game, Deadlands: Doomtown by Alderac Entertainment Group!

All aspects of the game that require randomization are controlled via a poker mechanism as every card has a suit and value. Preparing for the hands you want to draw is as much a part of deck building as choosing the actions and dudes you'll want to play. Your deck is built around an Outfit, one of the six main groups attempting to control Deadwood.

Combat is resolved via poker hands. Deciding who goes first is decided by drawing the top five cards from your deck and the lowest poker hands go first.

Players take one action each, in turn which can include:

Hiring a new dude (getting you influence in town)
Purchasing a new deed (getting you control in town)
Shopping for gear for your dudes
Start a shootout with your opponents to try to remove their influence.


When each player passes, you reach "Sundown" for the day. If any player has more control in town than anyone else has influence, you win.

-description from publisher

listing.notes:
Sadly I don't have anyone to play with. Therefore I'm selling my "Doomtown Weird West Edition Full Playset" edition and all stretch goals.
If anyone is interested, please get in touch for further details.

boardgame.name: Sushi Scramble
boardgame.description:
GRAB THE SUSHI! In this fun children's game, players use chopsticks to grab pieces of sushi that match the menu card before the chef knocks them off the belt. Get them all before the chef gives you the CHOP!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 一瞬の名画、あるいは無意識の目覚め (A momentary masterpiece or an unconscious awakening)
boardgame.description:
一瞬の名画、あるいは無意識の目覚め (A momentary masterpiece or an unconscious awakening) is a drawing and deduction game from Japan. Players take on the roles of artists and critics, and create artworks to be assessed by the other players.

The game has a deck of cards with themes and other with interpretations. A player creates a drawing and displays it in a picture frame. The other players critique the work according to the choices on the cards (ABC, 123) and vote with markers on the rondel. Does the artwork represent A1 or C2 and so on. Then the artist reveals the intent they had written down.

Players then advance their meeples on the rondel depending on how well they did compared to the expectation.

The game be played with young children by using simple themes and motifs. The intent is to create a happy interaction between artists.
user summary

boardgame.name: Puff Ball
boardgame.description:
PUFF, RACE, WIN. In Puff Ball, players will have to take the ball from cup to cup and through a series of obstacles to the end of the track. But there's a twist - you can only do so by puffing the ball.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Conflict of Dreams
boardgame.description:
Players build a deck of cards and duel against their opponent's deck. Players are champions attempting to reduce their opponent's life total to zero. The first player to reduce the opponent's champion to zero or otherwise destroy the opponent's champion card is the winner..

First off, the game has a deck construction element to it, which is done before to the actual game by choosing what cards are included in a deck. This must include 1 champion card, no more, no less and 50 other cards of the players choice, although a player cannot have more than 3 copies of any card.

The game has four major factions, all of which use champion, cast and reaction cards, besides that each faction has their own special types of cards they can use:
The Meritus uses equipment cards (such as swords and shields) and equipping these cards allows their champion to use them as an extension of his/herself.
The Sortis has enchantments which have over time effects and they also have spell cast cards.
The Divitiae have construct and upgrade cards so they can build machines and improve them.
Diogeni have creature, plant and force of nature cards to gain bonus resources and grow stronger over the course of the game.

Players gain resources and draw cards from their deck to determine what they can play each turn. Many cards have bonus conditions or options which allow for advanced strategies. There is a good list of game mechanics, including a mechanic called "the conflict" which lets players respond to each others action and allows more skilled players the opportunity to pull ahead while remaining easy enough for new players to learn.

Though the game is intended for a two-player duel, there is room to allow more players to play.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: El Bucanero
Los Lingotes del Gran Bucanero
El Tesoro del Bucanero
boardgame.description:
Letters are placed in the center of the table. All the silver coins are distributed in equal parts.

The gold coins are in the power of a single player (who will be called the payer) who will then distribute 5 cards to each player.

These should be face down.

After a signal each one turns over their first card.

The player who first made all the words that indicate his 5 cards gives the signal to stop.

Each player must pay the participant who completed all the words first, a silver coin for each card that he did not complete.

If the player who stops the game does not have all 5 words complete or there are spelling errors, he pays a fine of 2 silver coins to each of the players. When the collection is settled, the cards are redistributed, leaving aside those used in the previous round.

It is played over 5 rounds and the winner is the one who accumulates the most points at the end.


Originally release in 1940's by Casa Estanciero.

It is one of the best board games created in Argentina, and for 6 decades it has been entertaining young and old alike. It is quick to play, since with the large number of letters there are, you will have to put together the words that correspond to the definitions of the cards. In this way, you can win the treasure of gold and silver coins.

boardgame.name: A Little Knowledge
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

This adds a handful of simple skills to Mausritter which characters can acquire as they advance in level, at the expense of gaining Grit.

Hopefully this will provide mice with new and inventive ways of getting themselves into trouble!

boardgame.name: 世界恐蝗 (The World's Fear of Locusts)
boardgame.description:
世界恐蝗 (The World's Fear of Locusts) is a co-operative game from Japan for three players only. Players are working to stop locust swarms across the world by researching grasshoppers, and by attack swarms of locusts spreading on the wind.

Each player takes on a role in the game, entomologist (Studying insects), a control expect, and a supply expert. The players win by completing their research and eliminating the locust swarms. Even under harsh conditions, players can work out a successful solution.

The game board shows various sections of land, and a spinner decides the wind direction, controlling how the locusts spread. The game includes 3D grasshoppers and locusts.
user summary

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Vehicle Guide
boardgame.description:
In this 70 page book are suggested vehicle builds for the 32 miniatures released in the Car Wars Sixth Edition four player core game and four miniature set expansions. There are 32 builds for smaller games, and 32 more for larger games, making a total of 64 unique designs that utilize game cards from the sets listed below:


Core Set
Miniatures Set 1
Miniatures Set 2
Miniatures Set 3
Miniatures Set 4
Armory Pack
Linked Weapons Pack
Crew Pack
Dropped Weapons Pack
Uncle Al's Upgrade Pack


Also included are two scenarios that provide custom arena setups and unique, scenario-specific rules to add even more variety, strategy, and chaos to your duels.

boardgame.name: Bought Red Handed
boardgame.description:
The outrageous story-telling game where you battle to put together the world's most unfortunate shopping cart.

Forget window-shopping, it's time to splash the cash and hit "checkout" in this messed-up game of materialism! Filled with 400 item cards - anything from duct tape to 1,500 live lady bugs - players battle it out to submit the funniest combination of items for the purchasing scenario listed on the situation and trap cards.

Will you have to buy a wedding present for your ex-partner for under $20? Or pick up supplies for a romantic getaway within a short time limit?

Once you've selected your items, get ready to weave a funny story to explain your choices and win the round!

boardgame.name: Mittelmäßig
boardgame.description:
A 2 player Jass with a traditional deck. Each player plays against the other player and also a single shared “dummy” who is considered a player in its own right but whose cards are played by both. The goal is to capture tricks so that one’s total captured card-points are either the highest or the lowest of the two humans and dummy--that is, avoiding being in the middle. After each hand the top and bottom slots earn sticks (positive game points) while the middle slot earns potatoes (negative game pts). As both players compete against each other over eight hands to earn the most sticks, the Winner must also ensure the Dummy doesn’t beat them both--because if it wins, both humans lose, equally. A perverse game of positioning!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Barby
boardgame.description:
Barby is a 2 player compendium game with a traditional deck adapted from Barbu. Barby consists of a series of hands where players choose one of seven possible games. Each game offers a task (such as avoiding the last two tricks, or trying to avoid winning Queens). After fourteen deals, each player must call each game once. The game cycles through each player's narrowing choices. Mandatory doubles keep the tension high.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: HotRod
boardgame.description:
HotRod is a game of collecting fast cars and modifying them to race on different terrains. Players use dice to create tracks, collect HotRods or modify them. Every 5th turn, players will complete a scoring round for one of the Bonus cards. Players may want to delay a bonus card, but doing so will only offer them half of their points.

Specializing in certain Terrains or Track types can help players win big when they race each of their collected HotRods at the end of the game.

Uses language independent components!

HotRod is playable by 1-100 players (or more) in 30-60 minutes. HotRod is part of Roll and Write Revolution! Digital release initially, digital and physical copies will be available from the Game Crafter after the campaign ends.

boardgame.name: ゴープラム 踊る彫刻 (Gopuram Dancing Sculpture)
boardgame.description:
ゴープラム 踊る彫刻 (Gopuram Dancing Sculpture) is a game from Japan in which players are constructing a Gopuram. This is an entrance tower at a Hindu temple in Southern India. The tower is covered in elaborate, colourful statues of dancing Hindu gods. The players are the sculptors, seeking inspiration as they construct their own Gopuram.

The game has a set of cards of dancers used to form a circle. Players move glass stones around this circle in the style of a Mancala game. As they move the stones around, they build up on an animal for each player.

When the player has got enough stones on their animal, they move them on and draw sculpture cards. These show four carved figures in different colours. Players add the cards they draw to the one card they started with at the centre of their tower. In doing so, players want to complete a tower of 4,3 and then 2 cards, but with sets of coloured statues lining up in groups.

When a player completes a tower, they take a bonus card of Vishnu to top out their tower. The other players get a chance to finish their towers, and scores are calculated from groups of figures and bonus points.

The most points wins the game for the best sculpture.
user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Chonmage Game (ちょんまげ工務店)

boardgame.name: Town Hall: A Card Game
boardgame.description:
The game starts with players designing the Town by choosing from the 12 available districts, ranging from forest to the central business district. Changing the set up of the Town means that the game has more variability over time as districts advantage different candidates. Players are also assigned purple 'values' cards, which they share with the players next to them. This means you have things in common but, in a 4 player game, have nothing in common with the person sitting across from you! Values are important: your candidates perform better if they have the same values and your projects give you more legacy points if they also align with your values.

Once the Town is established and the districts chosen, players select cards (their candidates and inventory) and begin building up their arsenal for the upcoming elections. Be sure to select good candidates! They come with one or more Persuasive (P), Strategic (S) or Ruthless (R) skills which determines the number and type of actions they can make as candidates and later on as councillors.

Each district is up for election and players spend resources trying to ensure their candidate comes out as the winner. Players adopt the persona of their candidate and give a short 'campaign speech' to the table, outlining why they deserve your vote. The player with the "best speech" wins additional support which increases their odds of being elected. Support is also increased by the candidate's popularity in that district and any other cards you burn to give you a competitive edge. Be careful: the more you burn now, the less you can do once you're in Town Hall! Each candidate elected is worth legacy points, which decide the game.

Winning candidates become councillors who can complete project in their term of office if they have the necessary skills (P, S or R). Complete a project and get more legacy points. Diversity is key: players are rewarded bonus points for a complete PSR set of 3. At the end of 3 rounds the player with the highest number of legacy points is the winner! For experienced players, there is the option to include an add-on mode where the Mayor of the day tries to persuade players to support their proposal.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Rolling Pins
boardgame.description:
Roll and Write game for 1 or more players. Rolling Pins is a simulation of Bowling. Based on a mechanic of Shut the Box with addition of special abilities that can be used to manipulate the dice, or score an automatic strike.

Rolling Pins was created for the 10th Roll & Write PnP Contest.
The files are available for free.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable
